how_to_read: Phases: BFC = back-foot contact, FFC = front-foot contact (primary reporting phases).
RUNUP_LAST and BOUND are upstream rhythm phases used internally; summaries focus on BFC/FFC.
CT (contact time): foot-ground duration; lower is faster/stiffer, higher is longer/softer.
Impulse proxy: integrated load over contact; higher implies greater force-time output.
Loading-rate proxy: early rise of load; higher indicates sharper impact/bracing.
Values are within-athlete proxies for this session (no external force calibration).
Bands (very_low→very_high) are percentile-based within this session.

metric_glossary.ct_s: Contact time (seconds): duration of stance contact.
metric_glossary.impulse_proxy: Impulse proxy (a.u.): area under pressure curve during contact.
metric_glossary.loading_rate_proxy: Loading-rate proxy (a.u./s): initial slope of loading.
metric_glossary.peak_proxy: Peak pressure proxy (a.u.): maximum instantaneous pressure proxy.
metric_glossary.heel_share_0_1: Heel share (0–1): fraction of total load under heel.

interpretation.label: Tired Legs, Harder Landing
interpretation.explanation: Your back leg is slowing down as fatigue sets in. To keep the pace up, your body is hitting the front leg harder. You're working harder for the same result : or less.
interpretation.what_youre_doing: Allowing back-foot contact to drag as eccentric strength fades, then compensating with aggressive front-leg impact to maintain release speed.
interpretation.why_it_happens: Spell length exceeding current capacity, inadequate recovery between overs, or cumulative load from previous sessions.
coach_cues: Rhythm over effort : stop trying to muscle it
Light feet through the run-up
If the timing's gone, shorten the spell

impact.pace: Diminishing returns : more effort, same or less speed
impact.load: Front leg absorbing what the back leg can no longer handle
impact.injury_risk: High : this is when injuries happen

training_focus.title: Training Focus for the Next 7 Days
training_focus.load_guidance: Reduce bowling load this week : focus on recovery and technique

drills.name: Active Recovery Walk
key_points: Walk at a natural, comfortable pace
Focus on deep, controlled breathing
Keep the body relaxed

drills.name: Front Leg Brace Walk-throughs
key_points: Walk through the action at 20% speed
Snap the front knee into extension at FFC
Feel the 'block' of the front leg

drills.name: Active Recovery Walk
key_points: Walk at a natural, comfortable pace
Focus on deep, controlled breathing
Keep the body relaxed

drills.name: Front Leg Brace Walk-throughs
key_points: Walk through the action at 20% speed
Snap the front knee into extension at FFC
Feel the 'block' of the front leg

drills.name: Front Leg Brace Walk-throughs
key_points: Walk through the action at 20% speed
Snap the front knee into extension at FFC
Feel the 'block' of the front leg

training_focus.progression: Only progress to low-amplitude bounds if fatigue symptoms have fully resolved and the bowler feels fresh.
training_focus.exit_goal: Bowler reports feeling fresh; shadow bowling shows no compensation patterns.

BFC.coach_text: Neutral BFC: Loading within expected ranges.

FFC.coach_text: Absorptive Bracing: Long contact and high energy absorption.

FFC: Front-foot contact time is long → energy leaks and bracing is less stiff.

training_focus.progression: Only progress to low-amplitude bounds if fatigue symptoms have fully resolved and the bowler feels fresh.
training_focus.exit_goal: Bowler reports feeling fresh; shadow bowling shows no compensation patterns.

BFC.coach_text: Braking Heel BFC: Heavy heel bias and prolonged contact.

FFC.coach_text: Absorptive Bracing: Long contact and high energy absorption.

FFC: Front-foot contact time is long → energy leaks and bracing is less stiff.

interpretation.label: Too Soft Through the Action
interpretation.explanation: You're not attacking the crease. Both legs are absorbing load instead of acting like stiff levers. It feels easy, but you're bleeding pace at every contact.
interpretation.what_youre_doing: Landing softly on both back and front feet, with excessive knee bend and no real 'snap' in the action.
interpretation.why_it_happens: Low intent, under-pacing the run-up, or protecting something without realising it. Can also happen when 'saving yourself' in a long spell.
coach_cues: Attack the crease like you mean it
Be aggressive through the bound
Brace hard on the front leg : commit to it

impact.pace: Significant : your legs aren't helping you, they're slowing you down
impact.accuracy: Variable : the soft base makes it hard to repeat
impact.load: Low immediate load, but inefficient patterns lead to fatigue-driven breakdown
impact.injury_risk: Low now, but technique erosion is a concern

key_points: Walk through the action at 20% speed
Snap the front knee into extension at FFC
Feel the 'block' of the front leg

drills.name: Front Leg Brace Walk-throughs
key_points: Walk through the action at 20% speed
Snap the front knee into extension at FFC
Feel the 'block' of the front leg

training_focus.progression: Only progress to low-amplitude bounds if fatigue symptoms have fully resolved and the bowler feels fresh.
training_focus.exit_goal: Bowler reports feeling fresh; shadow bowling shows no compensation patterns.

BFC.coach_text: Neutral BFC: Loading within expected ranges.

FFC.coach_text: Absorptive Bracing: Long contact and high energy absorption.

FFC: Front-foot contact time is long → energy leaks and bracing is less stiff.

interpretation.label: Too Soft Through the Action
interpretation.explanation: You're not attacking the crease. Both legs are absorbing load instead of acting like stiff levers. It feels easy, but you're bleeding pace at every contact.
interpretation.what_youre_doing: Landing softly on both back and front feet, with excessive knee bend and no real 'snap' in the action.
interpretation.why_it_happens: Low intent, under-pacing the run-up, or protecting something without realising it. Can also happen when 'saving yourself' in a long spell.
coach_cues: Attack the crease like you mean it
Be aggressive through the bound
Brace hard on the front leg : commit to it

impact.pace: Significant : your legs aren't helping you, they're slowing you down
impact.accuracy: Variable : the soft base makes it hard to repeat
impact.load: Low immediate load, but inefficient patterns lead to fatigue-driven breakdown
impact.injury_risk: Low now, but technique erosion is a concern

training_focus.load_guidance: Reduce bowling load this week : focus on recovery and technique

training_focus.progression: Only progress to low-amplitude bounds if fatigue symptoms have fully resolved and the bowler feels fresh.
training_focus.exit_goal: Bowler reports feeling fresh; shadow bowling shows no compensation patterns.

BFC.coach_text: Collapsing BFC: Extended contact time with slow loading.

FFC.coach_text: Absorptive Bracing: Long contact and high energy absorption.

FFC: Front-foot contact time is long → energy leaks and bracing is less stiff.

interpretation.label: Tired Legs, Harder Landing
interpretation.explanation: Your back leg is slowing down as fatigue sets in. To keep the pace up, your body is hitting the front leg harder. You're working harder for the same result : or less.
interpretation.what_youre_doing: Allowing back-foot contact to drag as eccentric strength fades, then compensating with aggressive front-leg impact to maintain release speed.
interpretation.why_it_happens: Spell length exceeding current capacity, inadequate recovery between overs, or cumulative load from previous sessions.
coach_cues: Rhythm over effort : stop trying to muscle it
Light feet through the run-up
If the timing's gone, shorten the spell

impact.pace: Diminishing returns : more effort, same or less speed
impact.load: Front leg absorbing what the back leg can no longer handle
impact.injury_risk: High : this is when injuries happen

session_summary.load_guidance: Monitor closely : session trends suggest building fatigue.

dashboard.meaning: Contact time: lower is quicker/stiffer; higher is longer/softer.
Impulse proxy: total load over contact.
Heel share: fraction of load under heel.

what_is_going_well.title: Repeatable run-up rhythm
what_is_going_well.claim: Contact timing in the final stride is consistent across deliveries.
what_is_going_well.why_it_matters: Stable approach rhythm supports momentum transfer into the crease.
keep_doing: Maintain current tempo and stride length through the run-up.

what_is_costing_you.title: Monitor: Approach drive fading late spell
what_is_costing_you.claim: Run-up force output is trending down across the spell.
what_is_costing_you.why_it_matters: Reduced drive means less momentum into the crease.
what_is_costing_you.risk_if_ignored: Momentum loss and technique breakdown late.

what_is_costing_you.title: Monitor: Run-up power declining (fatigue signature)
what_is_costing_you.claim: Force proxy in the final stride decreases from start to end.
what_is_costing_you.why_it_matters: Lower approach power reduces delivery momentum.

what_is_costing_you.title: Monitor: Run-up power declining (fatigue signature)
what_is_costing_you.claim: Force proxy in the final stride decreases from start to end.
what_is_costing_you.why_it_matters: Lower approach power reduces delivery momentum.

what_to_do_next.action: Reinforce stiffness and manage spell length.

dashboard.meaning: Contact time: lower is quicker/stiffer; higher is longer/softer.
Impulse proxy: total load over contact.
Heel share: fraction of load under heel.

what_is_going_well.title: Stable back-foot platform
what_is_going_well.claim: Back-foot contact time is consistent across deliveries.
what_is_going_well.why_it_matters: Consistent platform timing supports clean rotation into FFC.
keep_doing: Maintain current foot placement and snap timing.

what_is_costing_you.title: Monitor: Entry stiffness fading late spell
what_is_costing_you.claim: Back-foot elasticity is declining across the spell.
what_is_costing_you.why_it_matters: Less snap at BFC reduces rotation efficiency and drive.
what_is_costing_you.risk_if_ignored: Momentum loss and technique breakdown late.

what_is_costing_you.title: Monitor: Back-foot power declining (fatigue signature)
what_is_costing_you.claim: Force output at BFC decreases from start to end of spell.
what_is_costing_you.why_it_matters: Lower BFC power reduces bound drive.

what_is_costing_you.title: Monitor: Back-foot power declining (fatigue signature)
what_is_costing_you.claim: Force output at BFC decreases from start to end of spell.
what_is_costing_you.why_it_matters: Lower BFC power reduces bound drive.

what_to_do_next.action: Reinforce stiffness and manage spell length.

dashboard.meaning: Contact time: lower is quicker/stiffer; higher is longer/softer.
Impulse proxy: total load over contact.
Heel share: fraction of load under heel.

what_is_going_well.title: Repeatable bracing timing
what_is_going_well.claim: Front-foot contact time is stable across deliveries.
what_is_going_well.why_it_matters: Stable timing supports consistent bracing and release mechanics.
keep_doing: Maintain current rhythm and front-leg timing.

what_is_costing_you.title: Monitor: Bracing stiffness fading late spell
what_is_costing_you.claim: Loading-rate proxy drops in the last third of the spell.
what_is_costing_you.why_it_matters: Reduced bracing can leak momentum and reduce ball speed.
what_is_costing_you.risk_if_ignored: Momentum loss and technique breakdown late.

what_is_costing_you.title: Monitor: Force output declining (fatigue signature)
what_is_costing_you.claim: Force proxy at FFC decreases from start to end of spell.
what_is_costing_you.why_it_matters: Lower output reduces bowling effectiveness and increases compensations.

what_is_costing_you.title: Monitor: Force output declining (fatigue signature)
what_is_costing_you.claim: Force proxy at FFC decreases from start to end of spell.
what_is_costing_you.why_it_matters: Lower output reduces bowling effectiveness and increases compensations.

what_to_do_next.action: Reinforce stiffness and manage spell length.
